cluster_relations.rel_desc: Urban legends often include stories centered on haunted houses.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a narrative type or tradition commonly includes a given motif, setting, or supernatural element as part of its typical content.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: NarrativeRole: typical setting/location in such legends

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Urban legends frequently feature ghostly apparitions as central elements.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a narrative type or tradition commonly includes a given motif, setting, or supernatural element as part of its typical content.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: NarrativeRole: typical supernatural entity in such legends

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Urban legends include stories about mysterious creatures.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a narrative type or tradition commonly includes a given motif, setting, or supernatural element as part of its typical content.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: NarrativeRole: central beings in such legends

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a narrative type, genre, or tradition commonly includes a given motif, theme, setting, character type, or supernatural element as a typical part of its content.
args.justification: All three relations link the narrative category 'urban legends' to recurring content patterns (haunted houses, ghostly apparitions, mysterious creatures). The existing canonical_rel_name, rel_cls, and rel_cls_group are consistent and appropriate, but the shared canonical_rel_desc is slightly too narrow (focused mainly on settings and supernatural elements). Updating the description to also cover themes and character types better reflects the semantics of these instances while keeping the same predicate and class.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a narrative type, genre, or tradition commonly includes a given motif, theme, setting, character type, or supernatural element as a typical part of its content.
executed_decisions.justification: All three relations link the narrative category 'urban legends' to recurring content patterns (haunted houses, ghostly apparitions, mysterious creatures). The existing canonical_rel_name, rel_cls, and rel_cls_group are consistent and appropriate, but the shared canonical_rel_desc is slightly too narrow (focused mainly on settings and supernatural elements). Updating the description to also cover themes and character types better reflects the semantics of these instances while keeping the same predicate and class.
